channel.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
channel.description: I created an EC2 linux using the AMI provided here: https://redash.io/help/open-source/setup#-Setup and I can log into the linux instance with Putty or WinSCP, but I cannot get the landing page for redash using the DNS as explained in Setup. I updated the security rules to allow inbound SSH, HTTP, HTTPS and am using a key pair I generated on AWS when using Putty and WinSCP. I'm unclear what I'm missing to get the account setup.

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: Shermbo
item.description:
I can confirm:

AMI launch of v8 Redash
Security group allows SSH, HTTP, HTTPS
SSH works fine
CURL from RHEL 8 box works fine (to multiple end-points, /ping, /setup, etc)
Browser access to HTTP works
But browser access to HTTPS does not?? certificate issue?

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: narxeba
item.description:
Redash on AWS Instance Self Hosted Redash Support
I don’t know why, but the problem is in protocol https. I input manually HTTP:// and I reached start page of redash. Port 443 is opened, so I still don’t understand why i can’t reach with HTTPS protocol.

item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Alright, I have verified the V8 image works. I think the issue you have is you didn’t configure an inbound security group rule to access the instance. If you don’t do this it will appear as though the instance didn’t start.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
I’ll reiterate what I wrote above

Our working plan until we update the images for V10 is to recommend deploying the V8 images and then upgrading them like normal. If there are issues with the images, however, then this plan requires adjustment

Sounds like the V8 image just didn’t work for you. I will need to see if I can reproduce in my own AWS account…

Read full topic

redash.io

Setting up a Redash Instance

item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: jesse
item.description:
Not aware of any issues with these images. But testing this is on my agenda for the next couple of days. Our working plan until we update the images for V10 is to recommend deploying the V8 images and then upgrading them like normal. If there are issues with the images, however, then this plan requires adjustment

Read full topic

Are there any known issues with the current images?

item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.description:
I have this same problem, but using t2.small and t2.medium does not fix it.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: griffinator76
item.description:
@eafpres thanks for letting us know how you managed to resolve this. I think what has probably happened is that the t2.micro instance did not have enough resources to start all the containers (services) that Redash relies on hence it did not respond when you tried to browse the home page. The minimum recommended RAM for the Redash AMI is 2GB, which means a t2.small instance or better. In my experience you’ll probably find you need at least a t2.medium once you get any significant usage going.

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: eafpres
item.description:
Rebuiding using t2-small has fixed it

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: k4s1m
item.description:
Progress! This page means the nginx reverse proxy is functioning, but the Redash server itself isn’t actually responding. Are you certain the the container that runs Redash (called server in your docker-compose.yaml) is up and running?

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access after launching AWS image

item.title: Can't access after launching AWS image
item.dc:creator: k4s1m
item.description:
What message do you see when you try to connect? A few ideas:

If you see a 500 error
The server is receiving traffic but something went wrong.

If you see a 404 error
The server is receiving traffic but doesn’t know how to find Redash.

If you see a generic “could not connect to host” error
Then it’s probably an issue with DNS and your container isn’t receiving network traffic

Read full topic
